alert.note: Alert for McCulloch; San Saba (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued May 19 at 5:43PM CDT until May 19 at 7:45PM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: The National Weather Service in San Angelo has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... East Central McCulloch County in west central Texas... West Central San Saba County in west central Texas... * Until 745 PM CDT. * At 540 PM CDT, Radar indicated thunderstorms with very heavy rain over a part of eastern McCulloch and western San Saba Counties. These storms were repeatedly developing and tracking over the same area. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Rochelle. This includes the following Low Water Crossings... County Road 423 crossing Little Brady Creek and County Road 424 crossing Little Brady Creek. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
